sentences.english: "And also this affair must be discreet, " Kugelmass continued.
sentences.chinese: “然后同样这次外遇必须保密，”库马思继续。

sentences.english: She snooped through his things for his affairs.
sentences.chinese: 她把他的东西都翻了一遍，想要找他外遇的证据。

sentences.english: Were they junk mail or evidence her husband was having an affair?
sentences.chinese: 这些只是垃圾邮件呢，还是她丈夫有外遇的证据？

sentences.english: She feels devalued because she knows her husband has had affairs.
sentences.chinese: 她觉得自己掉价了，因为她知道丈夫有了外遇。

sentences.english: Don't suggest anything new, your partner will think you had an affair.
sentences.chinese: 不要试图尝试新的东西，你的伴侣会怀疑你有外遇了。

sentences.english: Gregor was rumored to be discontented and having affairs.
sentences.chinese: 传闻格雷戈尔对她不满，有了外遇。

sentences.english: She was rubber-heeling on her husband to find out whether he was carrying on with some other woman.
sentences.chinese: 她正在对丈夫进行内部调查，看他是否有外遇。

sentences.english: Has your partner had an affair?
Ms Wong said she had suspected that her husband had been having an affair for a long time.
sentences.chinese: 黄女士表示她早就怀疑丈夫有外遇。

sentences.english: Is jealousy the antidote to cheating?
The two became estranged over the years, and there were reports of infidelities from both parties.
sentences.chinese: 两人多年来变得疏远，双方都有外遇的传闻。

sentences.english: They quarrel constantly, he has an affair.
sentences.chinese: 他们不断地争吵，他有了外遇。

sentences.english: What is interesting is that adultery seems to be decreasing.
sentences.chinese: 不过有趣的是，现在外遇的数量似乎在减少。

sentences.english: It was hitting below the belt to tell his wife about his extramarital affairs secretly.
sentences.chinese: 偷偷告诉他老婆他有外遇的事是暗箭伤人。

sentences.english: Every affair is different, and so are every woman's reasons for her involvement.
sentences.chinese: 每一场外遇都是不同的，女人们的理由也各不相同。

definition: derailment (railway accident)/to leave the rails/fig. to overstep bounds/fig. to have an extramarital affair
lit. the red apricot tree leans over the garden wall (idiom)/fig. a wife having an illicit lover
domestic violence/abbr. for 家庭暴力[jia1 ting2 bao4 li4]
to marry for the second time/second marriage/second spouse
sb who is romantically involved with sb already in a committed relationship/the other woman/the other man/third person/third party (in dispute)/disinterested party/number three in a list
change of affection, shift of love (idiom); to change one's feelings to another love/to fall in love with sb else
